content.description: Risky venture as you gain higher hands on smaller holds.

IMPORTANT! This route is incredibly obvious and has more than likely been done before (looking at you P. Beal)So if this has been done, notify me and I will change this details. Thanks!   Starting on the obvious flake undercling with the left hand and another good undercling about hip height around the arete, pull up on good feet and slap your way up the arete until you can make a lunge for a good crimp up high. After a bit of a flora heavy top out, take a moment to enjoy the view from the top before scrambling back down to high five your crew.
content.protection: Done with a single pad, but the landing is so flat and featureless that it could easily be done without one. Still, at least 1 pad recommended.
content.location: Walk around behind the lodestone and on the back side you will see the obvious arete, if it is still difficult to discern, take a look at the picture.

content.description: ATG climbs the clean section on the back of the Lodestone, starting with a small flake and heading up into the moss and ferns. Despite the appearance the climbing is good

pathTokens: Bradbury Mountain State Park (CLOSED to Climbing Oct '17)

content.description: This is the massive upper boulder. It is readily identified by a smooth slabby east face crossed by diagonal seams with a big low overhang on the corner. All the sides except the north face proper have problems.
